intro: Calyptochloa sphaerocarpa, commonly known as the globe-berry grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is characterized by its small, spherical seed heads that resemble berries, giving it its common name. The plant is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a dense growth habit that helps it conserve water. Calyptochloa sphaerocarpa is often found in disturbed areas and can serve as an indicator of dry, nutrient-poor environments.
